name: Muslim Aid America
mission: PROVIDE HELP TO PEOPLE WHO ARE VICTIMS OF NATURAL DISASTERS OR CONFLICTS OR SUFFERING FROM POVERTY, HUNGER, DISEASE, ILLITERACY, DISCRIMINATION, HOMELES...

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 39/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build reserves toward your board-approved target range (often 3-12 months), adjusted for revenue volatility and obligations.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

judge_issues.message: Multiple different EINs found across sources: {'462504422', '454411111'}
Evaluation source domain 'mausa.org' is not a known trusted evaluator

score_details.score_summary: Muslim Aid America shows strong alignment and good impact (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: CORROBORATION FAILED: Discovered via search (confidence=0.50) (Source: https://www.muslimaidusa.org/donate/)

all_citations.claim: Muslim Aid America focuses on providing help to victims of natural disasters, conflict, poverty, and hunger.
The organization reported total revenue of $26,177,076, a program expense ratio of 93.2%, and fundraising efficiency of $0.04 per $1 raised.
The organization offers various donation methods for supporters to contribute sadaqah to humanitarian programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a solid score due to its high financial efficiency and direct service model, though its overall rating is moderated by moderate working capital levels.
areas_for_improvement: Relatively lean liquidity with 2.1 months of working capital available.
Limited public third-party impact evaluations or cost-per-beneficiary data.

dimension_explanations.alignment: Muslim Aid America shows high alignment for donors seeking to support urgent humanitarian causes through sadaqah [3]. The organization's mission to serve victims of conflict and natural disasters aligns with high-priority global needs, and its established track record provides a reliable pathway for charitable giving [1][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates a strong commitment to direct service, allocating 93.2% of its $26,177,076 revenue directly to programs such as water wells and food security [2]. While it maintains high financial health and low fundraising costs of $0.04 per $1 raised, specific evidence regarding the long-term cost-effectiveness per beneficiary is not fully documented in public filings [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Muslim Aid America provides essential humanitarian relief to victims of natural disasters, conflict, and poverty through high-efficiency programming.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 93.2%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.04 per $1 raised.
Strong focus on urgent humanitarian causes including food security and water access.
baseline_narrative.summary: Muslim Aid America is a humanitarian organization dedicated to assisting individuals suffering from hunger, disease, and illiteracy across the globe [1]. In the most recent fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $26,177,076 to support its mission of providing aid to those in crisis [2]. Donors can contribute to these efforts through various sadaqah-eligible giving options hosted on their platform [3].

all_citations.quote: Donate your Sadaqah to help those in need.

all_citations.claim: Emergency Relief, Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH), and Food Security
all_citations.quote: Programs: Emergency Relief, WASH, Food Security, Health, Education
No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a solid score due to its high financial efficiency and direct service model, though its overall rating is moderated by moderate working capital levels.

areas_for_improvement.context: While programs are extensive, there is <cite id="7">no publicly available cost-per-beneficiary data</cite> to help donors assess comparative effectiveness.
The organization currently holds <cite id="7">2.1 months of working capital</cite>, which is lean compared to the recommended 3-12 month safety net for large-scale humanitarian operations.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains 100% independent board and audited financials.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The high program ratio suggests funds are reaching the field, and the Platinum transparency seal indicates a willingness to improve reporting.
risk_factors: <cite id="7">No third-party impact evaluations or RCT-level evidence</cite>
<cite id="7">Working capital is below the 3-month industry benchmark</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="7">limited impact evidence</cite> and lean financial reserves.

confidence.notes: Financial metrics are highly consistent across sources.

alignment.explanation: The organization shows <cite id="5">high alignment with Muslim donor priorities</cite> through its focus on humanitarian crises in <cite id="5">Muslim-majority regions</cite> and its Islamic organizational identity.
alignment.improvement: The charity could improve alignment by <cite id="7">expanding services to more underserved geographies</cite> with limited existing nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="4">Platinum Seal from Candid</cite> and its <cite id="1">100% independent board</cite>. The organization also undergoes <cite id="2">annual financial audits</cite> and maintains a high <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.04 per $1 raised</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could <cite id="7">document a clear theory of change</cite> with an explicit causal pathway for its various program areas.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="2">93.2% program expense ratio</cite>. The charity focuses on <cite id="5">direct service delivery</cite> in high-need areas, though <cite id="7">cost-per-beneficiary metrics</cite> are not currently tracked.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="7">publishing consistent beneficiary counts</cite> and seeking external evaluations to move beyond self-reported outcomes.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Outcomes measured but not externally verified

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Directs over 98% of grants to foreign humanitarian relief efforts.

rich_narrative.headline: Muslim Aid America provides essential humanitarian relief to victims of natural disasters, conflict, and poverty through high-efficiency programming.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize maximum financial efficiency and want their sadaqah to go directly to emergency relief in global conflict zones.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure over 98% of their donation reaches the field
Care about immediate humanitarian relief in places like Gaza and Yemen
Value high transparency ratings like the Candid Platinum seal
Prefer supporting established organizations with a 10+ year track record
giving_considerations: The organization operates with lean reserves, making it highly responsive but potentially vulnerable to revenue shocks
Impact is reported through internal metrics rather than independent academic studies
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors specifically seeking to fulfill zakat obligations or those who require rigorous, third-party RCT evidence before giving.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while <cite id="4">one outcome metric is tracked via Candid</cite>, there is no external evaluation or published cost-effectiveness data.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization operates on the model that direct provision of food, water, and medical aid in crisis zones leads to immediate poverty alleviation and survival.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that high program spending actually translates into long-term improvements for beneficiaries.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="2">24.2% growth rate</cite> and massive humanitarian needs in its target regions, the organization has significant capacity to absorb more capital.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="2">93.2% program ratio</cite>, which is significantly higher than the <cite id="6">peer median of 87.6%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on water and nutrition
similar_organizations.name: Action Against Hunger USA

similar_organizations.differentiator: Larger institutional focus on Palestinian relief
similar_organizations.name: UNRWA

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="2">93.2% of its total expenses</cite> toward program services, significantly exceeding the <cite id="6">peer median of 87.6%</cite>.
Muslim Aid America demonstrates high fiscal discipline, spending only <cite id="1">$0.04 to raise every $1</cite> in charitable contributions.
The charity has earned the <cite id="4">Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>, the highest level of recognition for nonprofit data sharing.

strengths_deep_dive: Muslim Aid America's financial health is characterized by rapid growth and low overhead. With a <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 24.2%</cite>, the organization has successfully scaled its <cite id="2">foreign grants to $21,997,452</cite>, primarily targeting international relief. This scale is managed by a <cite id="1">100% independent board of directors</cite>, ensuring strong fiduciary oversight. Furthermore, the organization maintains a <cite id="1">working capital ratio of 2.3 months</cite>, allowing for responsive emergency interventions in volatile regions like <cite id="5">Sudan, Somalia, and Lebanon</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Muslim Aid America is a humanitarian organization dedicated to assisting individuals suffering from <cite id="1">hunger, disease, and illiteracy</cite> across the globe. Founded in <cite id="4">2012</cite>, the organization has scaled its operations significantly, reporting a <cite id="2">total revenue of $26,177,076</cite> in the most recent fiscal year. The charity operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 93.2%</cite>, which ensures that the vast majority of donor contributions directly fund field operations. Their work spans critical sectors including <cite id="5">Emergency Relief, Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH), and Food Security</cite>. By focusing on <cite id="5">direct service delivery</cite> in crisis zones such as Gaza, Yemen, and Syria, Muslim Aid America addresses immediate survival needs while implementing sustainable projects. The organization’s growth is evidenced by a <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 24.2%</cite>, reflecting increasing donor trust and operational capacity.
